content:
The chunk describes functionality for handling wildcard patterns in module names (`*.py`), particularly when determining parent modules and directories during module discovery or manipulation. This likely pertains to dynamic module resolution or override mechanisms within a package management system.

assert moduleName.endswith('.*')
        assert newName.endswith('.*')

        mdefs = {}

        # Find the parent module, so we can get its directory.
        parentName = moduleName[:-2]
        newParentName = newName[:-2]
        parentNames = [(parentName, newParentName)]

        if parentName.endswith('.*'):
            assert newParentName.endswith('.*')
            # Another special case.  The parent name "*" means to
            # return all possible directories within a particular
            # directory.
